vortex

Class GameEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • vortex.GameEntity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Camera, Pawn, Textbox, TileMap

    public abstract class GameEntity
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates the base for all entities in the game. Anything that can be drawn or updated is considered an entity. This excludes key and mouse input however. All entities have the ability of being drawn to the screen and updated. This does not mean that all do by default though. For instance a camera does not draw anything to the screen by default, but a Pawn or Map does.

    If you wish to create your own entity it is best to inherit from one of the already defined entities, or in the very least, inherit this class directly.

    Author:
    Daniel Stumpff

        Parameters:

        i - The amount of time that's passed since last update in milliseconds

        g - The Graphics object to draw to
